name: 11 Com
scenarioDescription:
The 11 Com Exoplanetary System


Overview

11 Com is a star with 2.7 times the mass of the Sun, and 19 times its radius. It is located 304.53 light years away from the solar system.

11 Com is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the 11 Com system


11 Com b

11 Com b was discovered by the Xinglong Station observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 1.29 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of 11 Com b is 6169.2 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, 11 Com b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system 11 Com, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by Xinglong Station.
